intro: Anethum panmorium, commonly known as wild anise, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant features slender, branched stems and small white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild anise-like aroma. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
